qas.question: What served as a justification for imposing imperialistic policies on certain peoples or regions?
What was thought to decide a person's behavior?

answers.text: the environment in which they lived
the environment in which they lived

qas.question: Humans in tropical environments were considered what?
Europe first colonized the Americas, then Asia, but what continent was third?
What were the two forms of environmental determinism?
What did not serve as a justification for imposing imperialistic policies on certain peoples or regions?

plausible_answers.text: the environment in which they lived

qas.question: What was not thought to decide a person's behavior?
Humans in tropical environments were not considered what?
Europe first colonized the Americas, then Asia, but what continent was fourth?
What were the three forms of environmental determinism?

context: The concept <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4><b5_0>environmental determinism<b5_0/><a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> served as a moral justification for domination of certain territories and peoples. It was believed that a certain person's behaviours were determined by <a1_0><a1_3><b6_0>the <a1_1><a1_2><a1_4>environment<a1_4/><a1_2/> in which they lived<b6_0/><a1_3/><a1_1/><a1_0/> and thus validated their domination. For example, people living in tropical environments were seen as "<a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4><b7_0>less civilized<b7_0/><a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>" therefore justifying colonial control as a civilizing mission. Across the three waves of European colonialism (first in the Americas, second in Asia and lastly in <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><a3_4><b8_0>Africa<b8_0/><a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>), environmental determinism was used to categorically place indigenous people in a racial hierarchy. This takes two forms, <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><a4_4><b9_0>orientalism and tropicality<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>.
